recipes.name: Eggplant Parmesan
recipes.description: This lighter take on the classic Italian dish uses oven-baked breaded eggplant slices instead of deep-frying to reduce grease and prep time while maintaining a crisp texture.
ingredients: 8 slices hearty white sandwich bread (torn into quarters)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (for sauce, to taste)
1/2 teaspoon black pepper (for sauce, to taste)
recipes.instructions:
1. Toss sliced eggplant with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt in a colander and let drain for 30 to 45 minutes until about 2 tablespoons of liquid is released. Wipe excess salt away, spread on paper towels, and pat thoroughly dry.
2. Adjust oven racks to upper-middle and lower-middle positions, place a rimmed baking sheet on each rack, and preheat oven to 425 degrees.
3. Pulse 8 slices of bread in a food processor (about 15 pulses) until you have 4 cups of fine crumbs. Transfer to a shallow dish and stir in 1 cup grated Parmesan and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
4. Combine 1 cup flour and 1 teaspoon pepper in a large zipper-lock bag. Beat 4 eggs in a second shallow dish.
5. Working with 8 to 10 eggplant slices at a time, shake in the flour bag to coat, dip in eggs, and then coat with the bread-crumb mixture. Transfer to a wire rack set in a separate baking sheet.
6. Remove preheated sheets from the oven. Add 3 tablespoons oil to each sheet, tilting to coat. Place eggplant on sheets in a single layer and bake for about 30 minutes, rotating sheets after 10 minutes and flipping slices after 20 minutes.
7. For the sauce: Process 2 cans of diced tomatoes in the food processor for 5 seconds. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil, 4 minced garlic cloves, and 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes in a saucepan over medium-high heat for 3 minutes.
8. Stir in the processed tomatoes and the 1 remaining can of diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for about 15 minutes until reduced to 4 cups. Remove from heat and stir in 1/4 cup chopped basil; season with salt and pepper.
9. Spread 1 cup sauce over the bottom of a 13 by 9-inch baking dish. Layer half of the eggplant slices, overlapping to fit. Top with 1 cup sauce and 1 cup mozzarella.
10. Layer remaining eggplant into the dish. Dot with 1 cup sauce (leaving most eggplant exposed to stay crisp). Sprinkle with 1/2 cup Parmesan and the remaining 1 cup mozzarella.
11. Bake until sauce is bubbling and cheese is browned, 13 to 15 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes, sprinkle with 10 torn basil leaves, and serve with any remaining sauce.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Hot and Sour Soup
recipes.description: A savory, tangy, and spicy traditional Chinese soup packed with a variety of mushrooms, tofu, and vegetables.

ingredients.item: 2 piece medium sized tomato (diced into small cubes)
ingredients.name: 2 piece medium sized tomato (diced into small cubes)

ingredients.item: 2 oz seafood mushroom (roots removed, stems cut in half)
ingredients.name: 2 oz seafood mushroom (roots removed, stems cut in half)

ingredients.item: 2 oz king oyster mushroom (cut into little strips)
ingredients.name: 2 oz king oyster mushroom (cut into little strips)

ingredients.item: 3 piece shiitake mushroom (cut into thin slices)
ingredients.name: 3 piece shiitake mushroom (cut into thin slices)

ingredients.item: 0.25 oz dried wood ear mushroom (rehydrated and cut into thin slices)
ingredients.name: 0.25 oz dried wood ear mushroom (rehydrated and cut into thin slices)

ingredients.item: 1 oz red bell pepper (approx. half a pepper, cut into thin strips)
ingredients.name: 1 oz red bell pepper (approx. half a pepper, cut into thin strips)

ingredients.item: 14 oz firm tofu (cut into thin strips)
ingredients.name: 14 oz firm tofu (cut into thin strips)

recipes.instructions:
1. Wash all vegetables. Prep ingredients by cutting 2 seafood mushrooms in half, slicing 2 oz king oyster mushrooms and 3 shiitake mushrooms into strips/slices, and cutting 14 oz tofu, 2 oz carrots, and 1 oz red bell pepper into thin strips. Mince 2 green onions and dice 2 tomatoes into small cubes.
2. Rehydrate 0.25 oz dried wood ear mushrooms (and shiitake if dried) in warm water for 10 minutes, then slice thinly.
3. In a small bowl, mix 3 tbsp cornstarch with 2 tbsp water to create a slurry. In a separate bowl, crack and beat 2 eggs.
4. Bring 5 cups of water to a boil in advance to save time.
5. Heat a wok on the highest heat setting. Add 1 tbsp corn oil and 2 dried chili peppers. Toss for 1 minute to infuse the oil, then remove and discard the chilies.
6. Add the diced tomatoes to the wok and cook for 30-60 seconds.
7. Pour in the 5 cups of boiling water. Add 1 tsp white pepper and stir for 15-30 seconds.
8. Add 1 tsp salt, 1 tbsp sugar, 2 tbsp light soy sauce, and 0.50 tbsp dark soy sauce. Stir for 15-30 seconds.
9. Add the prepared tofu, all mushrooms, carrots, and bell peppers (everything except green onions). Stir gently for 5-10 seconds.
10. Cover the wok with a lid and bring the mixture to a boil (about 3-4 minutes).
11. Uncover the wok. Give the cornstarch slurry a quick stir, then slowly pour it into the soup over 50-60 seconds while stirring constantly to thicken.
12. Slowly pour the beaten eggs all around the wok over 20-30 seconds. Do not stir immediately to allow egg ribbons to form.
13. Add 2 tbsp vinegar and 1 tsp sesame oil (to taste). Stir in the minced green onions and serve immediately.
